name: Kuramoto–Sivashinsky equation (spatiotemporal chaos)
equations: u_t + u_{xx} + u_{xxxx} + u u_x = 0  (with periodic boundary conditions)
description_simple: A PDE that generates spatiotemporal chaotic patterns.
description_complex: The Kuramoto–Sivashinsky equation is a nonlinear, fourth-order PDE that exhibits spatiotemporal chaos in extended domains. Solutions develop chaotic traveling waves and shifting cellular structures, with multiple positive Lyapunov exponents, complex attractor geometry, and statistical steady states.
